Lynn (Pei-Lin) Huang is a PhD candidate in Pharmaceutical Health Services Research at the University of Maryland, Baltimore (UMB), with a specialization in pharmacoeconomics. She was born in Taipei, Taiwan, and spent over a decade in China before relocating to the United States. She holds a Bachelor’s degree in Nutrition and Health Science and a Master’s degree in Health Economics and Outcomes Research.
Her research focuses on the generation of real-world evidence to support value-based care and reduce health disparities, with particular emphasis on individuals with cancer. She has contributed to studies in oncology, cardiovascular disease, and substance use disorder, employing advanced analytic methods across diverse data sources, including electronic health records and claims data. Drawing on experience in both academic and industry settings, she integrates a multidisciplinary perspective into her work.
She has demonstrated strong professional leadership through service as President of the UMB ISPOR Student Chapter (2024–2025) and as the incoming Co-Chair of the Event Planning Committee for the ISPOR Student Network.
